intro: Stanhopea leucochila, commonly known as the white-lipped stanhopea, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking white petals and a distinctive, elongated lip that often has a pale green or yellowish hue. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are fragrant and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Stanhopea leucochila is valued in horticulture for its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
